Please read the following before contacting the ADC Community Moderator


As a community we would like for everyone to work together for the common goal of providing answers and informatin to all members of the community. We understand that when there is an open platform like this there will be members that don't follow the guidelines. Please read through the following scenarios and if any of them apply feel free to contact our moderators to help resolve the issue.


When to use the moderator feedback

  1. ï»¿ When you want to report a forum problem and you require a reply.
  2. Please provide as much information about the problem and how to duplicate it if possible
  3.  Site Feedback suggestions or comments.
  4. Please provide what your expectations would be and if possible, an example from another forum site.
  5.   You want to inquire about, question, or dispute a moderation action.
  6. If a moderation action has been taken against you, we will be happy to discuss it with you in a constructive manner and see if we can come to a resolution.
  7.   You want to inquire about forum rules or policies or ask if a thread topic would be OK. If you are in doubt about what you can post, we suggest that you ask in advance.
  8. This forum is new to us too. While we have covered the basic guidelines in our Community Guidelines document, we may have grey areas we will need to address.



When NOT to use the moderator feedback


  1. When you want to  report posts that break forum rules.
  2. Use the Flag on a specific post so it'll be handled more efficiently. (Exception: If you need a reply to a message about forum problems.)
  3. When you want to ask for help with technical problems with an AutomationDirect product.
  4. The real expertise are other customers in the community. Browse our extensive knowledge database or search the forums for an answer or start a thread with your question. 


Our Moderators will strive to answer any messages as quickly as possible. However, some issues may take some research and discussion with other members of our team or this community. We will not reply to spam, ads, or extremely rude messages.
